critique: The document is an executive order focused on government efficiency and consolidation during the Great Depression. It transfers the administration of the Longshoremen's and Harbor Workers' Compensation Act from the Employees' Compensation Commission to the Department of Labor. The order aims to reduce expenditures, increase efficiency, and consolidate agencies with similar functions. It also grants the Secretary of Labor the power to consolidate, eliminate, or redistribute bureaus within the Department of Labor to further these goals.
